title: One-year-old girl drowns in bath mum after leaves her alone and goes downstairs
text:

A one-year-old girl drowned alone in the bath after being left unsupervised by her mum at their home.

Little Alia Tawfeeq was pronounced dead at the Royal Stoke University Hospital in January 2017.

The 17-month-old toddler's death was recorded as ‘consistent with drowning’ after a post-mortem examination was carried out.

An inquest into Alia’s death has now been formally concluded, after her mother Aarazoo Tawfeeq pleaded guilty to cruelty to a child, Stoke on Trent Live reports.

Assistant coroner Sarah Murphy said: “The deceased was in the bath while her mother was downstairs.

"The mother had not been constantly supervising the child.

(Image: BPM MEDIA)

"The cause of death was drowning.”

The inquest into Alia's death was adjourned at North Staffordshire Coroner’s Court in April 2017, pending a decision from the Crown Prosecution Service as to whether criminal charges would be brought in the case.

In 2018, Tawfeeq was charged with manslaughter by gross negligence in relation to her daughter’s death.

She was due to go on trial in September this year, but pleaded guilty to a lesser charge of cruelty to a child, which was accepted by the Crown Prosecution Service.

The offence includes instances of neglect and failure to protect a child as well as cases involving assault and ill-treatment.

The 36-year-old, who at the time of Alia’s death lived at Alderley Rise in Burslem, received a nine-month prison sentence, suspended for 12 months.

Ms Murphy said: “Given the criminal proceedings where the facts surrounding the death have been heard in public I do not find sufficient reason to resume the inquest.

"That concludes matters regarding the very sad death of Alia Tawfeeq.”
description: Little Alia's mum Aarazoo Tawfeeq, from Stoke on Trent, Staffordshire, pleaded guilty to a cruelty charge but was given a suspended jail sentence
